llm_input_data.system_prompt: You are a helpful assistant, expert in social media blogging and online marketing
llm_input_data.task_prompt:
Convert the following image concept into a concise, vivid, and fully formed image description prompt for an image generation model. The output MUST include:

1. A complete and details summary of the visual scene, characters, setting, and mood described, using vivid and visual language suitable for image generation.
2. Tone: aim for literal representation of a single key idea. Avoid romanticism, cliché or stereotypes, and avoid multiculturalism unless specifically called for.
3. Be true to historic period, using modern settings for contemporary themes and more romantic settings for older times.

Only return the final prompt string suitable for image generation, NOT explanations. Note that image FORMAT such as style and dimensions is provided to the LLM separately so do NOT include any.  Now, here is the image description to summarise:
llm_input_data.image_prompts:
Title: Medieval Scottish Scribe at Work in a Monastery

Description: Set within the tranquil and hallowed walls of a medieval Scottish monastery, this scene unfolds as a dedicated monk meticulously records an ancient story, weaving together religious lore, ballads, and epic poems.

The monk, cloaked in a woolen habit, sits at a wooden desk, his face illuminated by the flickering light of a single candle. His parchment is spread out before him, a quill pen in hand, as he delicately dips it into an inkwell. The room is filled with the pungent aroma of burning wax, parchment, and aged books.

Intricately illustrated manuscripts adorn the shelves that line the stone walls, their gilded edges gleaming against the dimly lit chamber. A beautifully illuminated religious manuscript lies open beside him, its pages bursting with color and detail, a testament to the artistic skill of the monastery's scribes.

Bards, dressed in traditional Scottish garb, visit the monastery, their tales passed down through generations now committed to parchment. They share their stories aloud, their voices resonating within the stone walls, as the monks transcribe these narratives for future generations.

A sense of reverence and awe permeates this sacred space, as tales of heroic feats, love's enduring power, and moral teachings are etched into history, forever preserving Scotland's rich literary heritage.

Symbolism and themes from various aspects of medieval Scottish storytelling come to life in this scene. From the monks as guardians of these tales to the beautifully illustrated manuscripts and the bards who shared their stories aloud, this image celebrates the significance of storytelling during Scotland's medieval period.

data.revised_prompt: Depict a serene scene in a medieval Scottish monastery. A dedicated monk, garbed in a woolen habit, is illuminated solely by the flickering candlelight as he precisely inscribes an ancient story onto a spread-out parchment. He holds a quill pen meticulously, periodically dipping it into an inkwell. The room is permeated with the scent of burning wax, parchment, and time-worn books. Numerous elaborately illustrated manuscripts with shimmering gilded edges aligned on the stone wall shelves around the room. Adjacent to the monk lies a resplendent religious manuscript, bursting with vivid colors and details, bearing the testament to monastic artistic mastery. Visitors in traditional Scottish attire, known as bards, are also present in the monastery, orating age-old tales for the monks to preserve in written form. Their voices echo through the stone confines, adding a layer of resonance to the hallowed space. This scene embodies the reverence and awe that dominates this sacred sphere. It is a reflection of how tales of heroics, relentless love, and moral teachings were indelibly inscribed into history, eternally upholding Scotland's opulent literary tradition. The image encapsulates the significance of storytelling in medieval Scotland, from monks safeguarding the tales, to the grandeur of illustrated manuscripts, to the bards vocalizing their narratives.
